question: In the later half of the 18th century, various currencies were circulating in Bengal. Which among the following led to increase in the problems of Indian traders and peasants as Tax Payers?
option1: The values of the currencies widely fluctuated
option2: The British insisted on payment of revenue in their own currency
option3: The native currency was used at a rebate
option4: Currency coined in Calcutta was not accepted anywhere else
answer: The native currency was used at a rebate
explanation: The rebate or batta on the native currency was the main reason of the issues pertaining to the native traders and peasants as Tax Payers.
